info.description: AWS Greengrass seamlessly extends AWS onto physical devices so they can act locally on the data they generate, while still using the cloud for management, analytics, and durable storage. AWS Greengrass ensures your devices can respond quickly to local events and operate with intermittent connectivity. AWS Greengrass minimizes the cost of transmitting data to the cloud by allowing you to author AWS Lambda functions that execute locally.
info.title: AWS Greengrass

get.description: Retrieves a list of core definitions.

post.description: Creates a core definition. You may provide the initial version of the core definition now or use ''CreateCoreDefinitionVersion'' at a later time. AWS Greengrass groups must each contain exactly one AWS Greengrass core.

get.description: Retrieves information about a core definition version.
Lists the versions of a core definition.

post.description: Creates a version of a core definition that has already been defined. AWS Greengrass groups must each contain exactly one AWS Greengrass core.

get.description: Retrieves information about a core definition version.
Retrieves a list of device definitions.

post.description: Creates a device definition. You may provide the initial version of the device definition now or use ''CreateDeviceDefinitionVersion'' at a later time.

get.description: Retrieves information about a device definition.
Lists the versions of a device definition.

post.description: Creates a version of a device definition that has already been defined.

get.description: Retrieves information about a device definition version.
Retrieves a list of Lambda function definitions.

post.description: Creates a Lambda function definition which contains a list of Lambda functions and their configurations to be used in a group. You can create an initial version of the definition by providing a list of Lambda functions and their configurations now, or use ''CreateFunctionDefinitionVersion'' later.

get.description: Retrieves information about a Lambda function definition, including its creation time and latest version.
Lists the versions of a Lambda function definition.

post.description: Creates a version of a Lambda function definition that has already been defined.

get.description: Retrieves information about a Lambda function definition version, including which Lambda functions are included in the version and their configurations.
Retrieves a list of logger definitions.

post.description: Creates a logger definition. You may provide the initial version of the logger definition now or use ''CreateLoggerDefinitionVersion'' at a later time.

get.description: Retrieves information about a logger definition.
Lists the versions of a logger definition.

post.description: Creates a version of a logger definition that has already been defined.

get.description: Retrieves information about a logger definition version.
Retrieves a list of resource definitions.

post.description: Creates a resource definition which contains a list of resources to be used in a group. You can create an initial version of the definition by providing a list of resources now, or use ''CreateResourceDefinitionVersion'' later.

get.description: Retrieves information about a resource definition, including its creation time and latest version.
Lists the versions of a resource definition.

post.description: Creates a version of a resource definition that has already been defined.

get.description: Retrieves information about a resource definition version, including which resources are included in the version.
Retrieves a list of subscription definitions.

post.description: Creates a subscription definition. You may provide the initial version of the subscription definition now or use ''CreateSubscriptionDefinitionVersion'' at a later time.

get.description: Retrieves information about a subscription definition.
Lists the versions of a subscription definition.

post.description: Creates a version of a subscription definition which has already been defined.

get.description: Retrieves information about a subscription definition version.
Retrieves a list of groups.

post.description: Creates a group. You may provide the initial version of the group or use ''CreateGroupVersion'' at a later time.

get.description: Retrieves information about a group.
Retrieves the current CAs for a group.

post.description: Creates a CA for the group. If a CA already exists, it will rotate the existing CA.

get.description: Retrieves the current configuration for the CA used by the group.

put.description: Updates the Certificate expiry time for a group.

get.description: Retreives the CA associated with a group. Returns the public key of the CA.
Returns a history of deployments for the group.
Returns the status of a deployment.

delete.description: Disassociates the role from a group.

get.description: Retrieves the role associated with a particular group.

put.description: Associates a role with a group. Your AWS Greengrass core will use the role to access AWS cloud services. The role's permissions should allow Greengrass core Lambda functions to perform actions against the cloud.

get.description: Lists the versions of a group.

post.description: Creates a version of a group which has already been defined.

get.description: Retrieves information about a group version.

delete.description: Disassociates the service role from your account. Without a service role, deployments will not work.

get.description: Retrieves the service role that is attached to your account.

put.description: Associates a role with your account. AWS Greengrass will use the role to access your Lambda functions and AWS IoT resources. This is necessary for deployments to succeed. The role must have at least minimum permissions in the policy ''AWSGreengrassResourceAccessRolePolicy''.

get.description: Retrieves the connectivity information for a core.

put.description: Updates the connectivity information for the core. Any devices that belong to the group which has this core will receive this information in order to find the location of the core and connect to it.

post.description: Creates a software update for a core or group of cores (specified as an IoT thing group.) Use this to update the OTA Agent as well as the Greengrass core software. It makes use of the IoT Jobs feature which provides additional commands to manage a Greengrass core software update job.

Pinned.description: True if the function is pinned. Pinned means the function is long-lived and starts when the core starts.

Timeout.description: The allowed function execution time, after which Lambda should terminate the function. This timeout still applies to pinned lambdas for each request.

FunctionConfigurationEnvironment.description: The environment configuration of the function.

AccessSysfs.description: If true, the Lambda function is allowed to access the host's /sys folder. Use this when the Lambda function needs to read device information from /sys.

ResourceAccessPolicies.description: A list of the resources, with their permissions, to which the Lambda function will be granted access. A Lambda function can have at most 10 resources.

AutoAddGroupOwner.description: If true, GreenGrass automatically adds the specified Linux OS group owner of the resource to the Lambda process privileges. Thus the Lambda process will have the file access permissions of the added Linux group.

GroupOwner.description: The name of the Linux OS group whose privileges will be added to the Lambda process. This field is optional.

LocalDeviceResourceData.description: Attributes that define a local device resource.

GroupOwnerSetting.description: Group/owner related settings for local resources.

SourcePath.description: The local absolute path of the device resource. The source path for a device resource can refer only to a character device or block device under ''/dev''.

LocalVolumeResourceData.description: Attributes that define a local volume resource.

DestinationPath.description: The absolute local path of the resource inside the lambda environment.

GroupOwnerSetting.description: Allows you to configure additional group privileges for the Lambda process. This field is optional.

SourcePath.description: The local absolute path of the volume resource on the host. The source path for a volume resource type cannot start with ''/proc'' or ''/sys''.

Component.description: The component that will be subject to logging.

Space.description: The amount of file space, in KB, to use if the local file system is used for logging purposes.

Type.description: The type of log output which will be used.

LoggerDefinitionVersion.description: Information about a logger definition version.

Permission.description: The type of permission a function has to access a resource.

Force.description: If true, performs a best-effort only core reset.

Id.description: The resource ID, used to refer to a resource in the Lambda function configuration. Max length is 128 characters with pattern ''[a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+''. This must be unique within a Greengrass group.

Name.description: The descriptive resource name, which is displayed on the Greengrass console. Max length 128 characters with pattern ''[a-zA-Z0-9:_-]+''. This must be unique within a Greengrass group.

ResourceDataContainer.description: A container of data for all resource types.

ResourceAccessPolicy.description: A policy used by the function to access a resource.

Permission.description: The permissions that the Lambda function has to the resource. Can be one of ''rw'' (read/write) or ''ro'' (read-only).

ResourceId.description: The ID of the resource. (This ID is assigned to the resource when you create the resource definiton.)

ResourceDataContainer.description: A container for resource data. The container takes only one of the following supported resource data types: ''LocalDeviceResourceData'', ''LocalVolumeResourceData'', ''SageMakerMachineLearningModelResourceData'', ''S3MachineLearningModelResourceData''.

LocalDeviceResourceData.description: Attributes that define the local device resource.

LocalVolumeResourceData.description: Attributes that define the local volume resource.

S3MachineLearningModelResourceData.description: Attributes that define an S3 machine learning resource.

SageMakerMachineLearningModelResourceDat.description: Attributes that define an SageMaker machine learning resource.

ResourceDefinitionVersion.description: Information about a resource definition version.

S3MachineLearningModelResourceData.description: Attributes that define an S3 machine learning resource.

DestinationPath.description: The absolute local path of the resource inside the Lambda environment.

S3Uri.description: The URI of the source model in an S3 bucket. The model package must be in tar.gz or .zip format.

S3UrlSignerRole.description: The IAM Role that Greengrass will use to create pre-signed URLs pointing towards the update artifact.

SageMakerMachineLearningModelResourceDat.description: Attributes that define an SageMaker machine learning resource.

DestinationPath.description: The absolute local path of the resource inside the Lambda environment.

SageMakerJobArn.description: The ARN of the SageMaker training job that represents the source model.

SoftwareToUpdate.description: The piece of software on the Greengrass core that will be updated.

Source.description: The source of the subscription. Can be a thing ARN, a Lambda function ARN, 'cloud' (which represents the IoT cloud), or 'GGShadowService'.

Target.description: Where the message is sent to. Can be a thing ARN, a Lambda function ARN, 'cloud' (which represents the IoT cloud), or 'GGShadowService'.

SubscriptionDefinitionVersion.description: Information about a subscription definition version.

UpdateAgentLogLevel.description: The minimum level of log statements that should be logged by the OTA Agent during an update.

Message.description: A message about the connectivity info update request.

Version.description: The new version of the connectivity info.

CertificateExpiryInMilliseconds.description: The amount of time remaining before the certificate expires, in milliseconds.

CertificateAuthorityExpiryInMilliseconds.description: The amount of time remaining before the certificate authority expires, in milliseconds.

CertificateExpiryInMilliseconds.description: The amount of time remaining before the certificate expires, in milliseconds.

GroupId.description: The ID of the group certificate configuration.

UpdateTargets.description: The ARNs of the targets (IoT things or IoT thing groups) that this update will be applied to.

UpdateTargetsArchitecture.description: The architecture of the cores which are the targets of an update.

UpdateTargetsOperatingSystem.description: The operating system of the cores which are the targets of an update.

CreationTimestamp.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the version was created.

Version.description: The unique ID of the version.
